result.execSummary:
The defendant Depronce Antwon Burnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. DOC collect. Collect within first 6 months after release from custody.

superTimeConds.notes: Complete community service during extended supervision.

November 19, 2015
Community Service

Defendant Depronce Antwon Burnett in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court finds defendant guilty of count 2. Court orders 18 months prison, 5 years extended supervision, 100 hours community service during extended supervision. DOC collect. Counts 1 and 3 dismissed and read in. Sentence credit to be determined.
Ad Prosequendum
